title: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Liang 2013
citeAs: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Liang 2013 [Evidence]. Contributors: Brian S. Alper [Authors/Creators]. targetAttachment.title: Figure 2C Metabolic Surgery in the Treatment Algorithm for Type 2 Diabetes: A Joint Statement by International Diabetes Organizations [Journal Article]. Contributors: Francesco Rubino, David M Nathan, Robert H Eckel, Philip R Schauer, K George M M Alberti, Paul Z Zimmet, Stefano Del Prato, Linong Ji, Shaukat M Sadikot, William H Herman, Stephanie A Amiel, Lee M Kaplan, Gaspar Taroncher-Oldenburg, David E Cummings, Delegates of the 2nd Diabetes Surgery Summit. In: Diabetes care, PMID 27222544. Published June 2016. Available at: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27222544/.

note.text: Mean HbA1c at 12 months in Liang 2013 was 6% in Surgery group (n = 31) and 7.6% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 70)

description: Mean HbA1c at 12 months in Liang 2013 was 6 % in Surgery group (n = 31) and 7.6% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 70), mean difference -1.60% (95% CI -1.94% to -1.26%)

variableDefinition.description: 101 obese patients with T2DM and hypertension

observed.display: GroupAssignment: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass vs. medical treatment

variableDefinition.description: Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass vs. medical treatment (Usual Care or Usual Care plus Exenatide)

name: ComparativeEvidence_Mean_difference_in_HbA1c_between_Surgery_and_Medical_Lifestyle_groups_in_Liang_2013
